info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wpan-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for WPAN (Wireless Personal Area Network)
     operational data. WPAN implements Field Area
     Network support based on the IEEE 802.15.4 standard
     including support for RPL (IPv6 Routing Protocol for
     Low-Power and Lossy Networks described in RFC 6550).
     Copyright (c) 2021-2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Other Services
**Paths:** 61

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-wpan-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-wpan-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-wpan-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-wpan-oper.html)

disc-imin.description:
Discovery trickle timer Imin parameter
         (used for PAN Advertisements)

disc-imax.description:
Discovery trickle timer Imax parameter
         (used for PAN Advertisements)

disc-k.description:
Discovery trickle timer suppression constant
         (used for PAN Advertisements)

security-enabled.description:
Security is enabled. This includes 802.1x EAP-TLS
         for mutual authentication, 802.11i for key exchange
         and 802.15.4 MAC layer encryption and integrity.

admin-up.description: Indicates that the WPAN module is enabled

lfn.description: Limited Function Node support is enabled

items.description: RF PHY Mode

outage-server.description:
Outage server address where Power Outage Notifications and
         Power Restoration Notifications are forwarded to

dtls-relay.description: DTLS relay address (used during certificate enrollment)

peer-to-peer.description:
Forward packets from mesh endpoints which have
         other mesh endpoints as destination

items.description: Multicast group joined by the node
UDP port allowed for multicast traffic

peer-ip.description:
IP address used to connect the peer side
         WPAN interface to enable HA feature

session-id.description:
Session number used to connect the peer side
         WPAN interface to enable HA feature

port-number.description:
Port number used to connect the peer side
         WPAN interface to enable HA feature

standby-group.description: HSRP protocol group monitoring the WPAN interface

cfg-src.description:
HA feature configuration mode.
         In automatic mode (wpan-ha-mode-cfg-automatic),
         HA state is decided by HSRP.
         In manual mode (wpan-ha-mode-cfg-manual),
         HA state is designated by IOT Field Network Director

dodag-id.description:
RPL DODAG Identifier (this is always set to the
         first IPv6 address of the WPAN interface)

dio-imin.description: RPL DIO trickle timer Imin parameter exponent

dio-imax.description: RPL DIO trickle timer Imax parameter (number of doublings)

pon-instance.description:
RPL PON (Power Outage Notification)
         instance is enabled

pon-dio-imin.description: RPL PON instance DIO trickle timer Imin parameter exponent

pon-dio-imax.description:
RPL PON instance DIO trickle timer Imax parameter
         (number of doublings)

route-auto-poisoning.description: RPL route auto poisoning is enabled

rpl-opt-metric-container.description: RPL option metric container is enabled

cisco-option.description: Controls usage of the cisco option in DAO messages

src.description: The source of the timing pulse (software-generated or GNSS)

last-trigger.description: The last time a timing pulse was triggered

last-recv.description: The last time a timing pulse was received by the WPAN module

num-triggered.description: Total number of timing pulses triggered

num-received.description: Total number of timing pulses received by the WPAN module

num-sync.description: Number of timing pulses used for synchronization

src.description: The source of the timing pulse (software-generated or GNSS)

last-trigger.description: The last time a timing pulse was triggered

last-recv.description: The last time a timing pulse was received by the WPAN module

num-triggered.description: Total number of timing pulses triggered

num-received.description: Total number of timing pulses received by the WPAN module

num-sync.description: Number of timing pulses used for synchronization

ip.description: The IPv6 address of the node.

last-heard.description: Last time an EAP packet was received from the supplicant

has-cisco-info.description:
Cisco info present. This is a Cisco-specific
         option in the DAO messages to provide additional
         information about the node. Availability depends
         on configuration and support from the nodes

items.description: MPL domain joined by the node

parent-ip.description: The IPv6 address of the node's parent.

reachable.description: The node can be reached via this parent

priority.description:
Priority of this parent (lower number means higher
         priority)

hops.description: Number of hops to the root via this parent

etx-path.description: Path cost for expected transmission count metric

etx-link.description: Link cost for expected transmission count metric

rssi-reverse.description:
Received signal strength indicator based on packets
         received by the WPAN module from the node

rssi-forward.description:
Received signal strength indicator based on packets
         received by the node from the WPAN module

lqi-reverse.description:
Link quality index based on packets
         received by the WPAN module from the node

lqi-forward.description:
Link quality index based on packets
         received by the node from the WPAN module

id.description:
Seed identifier for MPL messages forwarded by
         the border router. This is an IPv6 address, and is
         normally set to the first unicast IPv6 address of
         the WPAN interface

num-msgs.description: Number of messages in the MPL buffer

expire.description:
MPL trickle timer expiration parameter
         (number of messages)

first-heard.description:
First time that a neighbor solicit message was received
         by the WPAN module from the node

phy-mode-reverse.description:
Link quality index based on packets
         received by the WPAN module from the node

phy-mode-forward.description:
Link quality index based on packets
         received by the node from the WPAN module

ipv6-reg.description:
The WPAN module has received a neighbor solicit with
         an address registration option from the node.
         This means that the node's address is considered on-link
         and IPv6 packets can be sent to it directly.

ip-expiry.description: Expiry time of the IPv6 registration if not refreshed.

outage-reported.description:
The time when the outage corresponding to this restoration
         occurred as reported by the node

first-received.description:
The first time this power restoration notification (for this node)
         was received. This is used to track performance of the restoration
         notification protocols and for troubleshooting

last-received.description:
The last time this power restoration notification (for this node)
         was received. This is used to track performance of the restoration
         notification protocols and for troubleshooting

restoration-reported.description: The time when the restoration occurred as reported by the node

relayed.description: The last EAP packet for this supplicant was relayed via another node

relay-ip-addr.description: IPv6 address of the node that relayed the last EAP packet from this supplicant

start-time.description: The start of the current session

num-rx.description: Number of packets received in the current session

num-tx.description: Number of packets transmitted in the current session

dot1x-cleanup.description: Dot1x cleanup enabled on interface. When enabled, dot1x sessions will be automatically removed when no longer needed.

cur-key-id.description: The ID of the current key

has-pmk.description: The supplicant has a Pairwise Master Key

pmk-expiry.description: Expiry time of the Pairwise Master Key

has-ptk.description: The supplicant has a Pairwise Temporal Key

ptk-expiry.description: Expiry of the Pairwise Temporal Key

items.description: Key IDs for each Group Transient Key that the supplicant has
Key IDs for each LFN Group Transient Key that the supplicant has

if-name.description: HA feature configured WPAN interface name

state.description:
HA detail state of the WPAN interface.
         State can be one of wpan-ha-mode-disabled,
         wpan-ha-mode-active, or wpan-ha-mode-standby

peer-ip.description:
IP address used to connect the peer side
         WPAN interface to enable HA feature

session-id.description:
Session number used to connect the peer side
         WPAN interface to enable HA feature

port-number.description:
Port number used to connect the peer side
         WPAN interface to enable HA feature

standby-group.description: HSRP protocol group monitoring the WPAN interface

cfg-src.description:
HA feature configuration mode.
         In automatic mode (wpan-ha-mode-cfg-automatic),
         HA state is decided by HSRP.
         In manual mode (wpan-ha-mode-cfg-manual),
         HA state is designated by IOT Field Network Director

tags.name: Cisco-IOS-XE-wpan-oper
tags.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for WPAN (Wireless Personal Area Network)
     operational data. WPAN implements Field Area
     Network support based on the IEEE 802.15.4 standard
     including support for RPL (IPv6 Routing Protocol for
     Low-Power and Lossy Networks described in RFC 6550).
     Copyright (c) 2021-2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.
